title: Remembering a Music Star: Tributes to Mani
summary: Musicians and fans are sharing kind words about Gary 'Mani' Mounfield, who played bass guitar in famous bands like the Stone Roses and Primal Scream. He passed away at 63 years old. People like Liam Gallagher from Oasis and Ian Brown from the Stone Roses said they are very sad and called him a hero and a great friend. Mani was known for his cool bass playing that helped create the 'baggy' music style in Manchester. He also played with Primal Scream for many years. His brother shared the news on Facebook, and many are thinking of his family, especially his twin boys who lost their mom not long ago. This article shows how much people loved and respected Mani for his music and his warm heart.

background_read: Gary 'Mani' Mounfield was a famous bass player from England. He was in the Stone Roses, a band that started in the 1980s and made popular music in a style called 'baggy,' which had danceable beats and cool guitar sounds. Later, he joined Primal Scream, another band that mixed rock and dance music. Mani was loved by many musicians and fans for his talent and friendly personality. He had a family with twin boys, and his wife passed away recently. This article helps us learn about his life and why people are sad he is gone.
